Package geometri

Interface GeometricShape

All Superinterfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<GeometricShape>
All Known Implementing Classes:
BasicGeometricShape, Circle, Ellipse, Line, Point, Rectangle, Square
public interface GeometricShape
extends java.lang.Comparable<GeometricShape>
This interface describes drawable geometric shapes. Each shape contains of: A rectangle surrounding the shape as narrowly as possible defined by its width, height and the position, the upper left corner of the rectangle, and a colour given as an object of java.awt.Color.

Furthermore the shapes may be compared. First the areas of the shapes are compared and if the areas are equal the then the perimeters are compared. The area and the perimeter of a Point are 0. The area of a Line is 0 and its perimeter is the double length of the line.

The shapes may be moved, but may not be modyfied in any other way. Only positive x och y coordinates are allowed for the position. Negative values for the coordinates gives an IllegalPositionException, which is declared in this package.

Finally, the shapes may be compared for equality, where all components except the positions of the shapes are compared for equality.

Version:
(nov 2019)
Author:
Bror Bjerner, Christer Carlsson, Uno Holmer, Pelle Evensen, evensen@chalmers.se

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    int compareTo​(GeometricShape f)

  • Method Details

    • getArea

      int getArea()
      Get the area of this shape rounded to closest integer.
      Returns:
      the computed area.

    • compareTo

      int compareTo​(GeometricShape f)
      The method compareTo compares the area and the perimeter of the shapes to decide if the given geometric shape is less or greater than this object. If they have the same area, the perimeter decides.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<GeometricShape>
      Parameters:
      f - The geometric shape to compare with.
      Returns:
      An integer smaller than 0 if this shape is smaller than the shape given as argument, 0 if the sizes are equal, and a positive integer otherwise.

    • fill

      void fill​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Fill the shape's area at the shape's position with the shape's colour.
      Parameters:
      g - A graphic pen to draw with.

    • move

      void move​(int dx, int dy) throws IllegalPositionException
      Move the shape the given distances. Check if the new coordinates are legal and if they are, set the position to the new coordinates. Otherwise an IllegalPositionException is thrown. Origo is (0,0) and only positive coordinates are legal.
      Parameters:
      dx - move the shape dx points to the right.
      dy - move the shape dy points down.
      Throws:
      IllegalPositionException - if any coordinate becomes negative.

    • getPerimeter

      int getPerimeter()
      Get the perimeter of this shape rounded to closest integer.
      Returns:
      the computed perimeter.

    • place

      void place​(int x, int y) throws IllegalPositionException
      Place the shape on given coordinates. Check if the coordinates are legal. Origo is (0,0) and only positive coordinates are legal. If they are legal, update the position with the new coordinates. Otherwise an IllegalPositionException is thrown.
      Parameters:
      x - Distance right from origo.
      y - Distance down from origo.
      Throws:
      IllegalPositionException
